#Text=Make Your Marketing
#Text=Appeal to the Customers You Want
#Text=One of the biggest challenges all small businesses face is attracting good customers .
#Text=The main difference between attracting any customer and a good customer is the appeal of your marketing message .
#Text=Having an appealing message is a critical part of marketing and has huge implications for keeping revenues flowing from the customers you want most .
#Text=Steps
#Text=When we think of finding and attracting customers , we tend to think of the relationship from our own perspective .
#Text=After all , it ’s what we offer that makes them want to do business with us , right ? Wrong !
#Text=Consumers today have more choices of whom to do business with and what selection to choose from than ever before .

#Text=And with everyone holding on to their money so tightly these days , the usual marketing approaches have become mostly ineffective when it comes to attracting the right customers that want what you have and are willing to pay you your asking price .

#Text=Attracting Customers is an Age Old Problem : Since commerce began , entrepreneurs and business owners have resorted to a variety of sales tactics and promotional gimmicks to lure potential customers to their place of business .

#Text=Not surprisingly , consumers eventually figure out these methods and become indifferent to offers of special discounts , creative pricing strategies , frequent shopper programs , and other limited time offers .

#Text=Add to this , the sheer number of merchants doing the same thing and you have a consumer that grows numb because they simply do n’t see the need to purchase or feel they really want what you sell at the time you want to sell it .
#Text=Enter one step here and then click " Add Step "

#Text=Viewpoint is a Big Part of the Problem When Attracting Customers : Small business owners are a proud and resilient bunch ! Most have worked very hard and sacrificed enormously to have the business that many times bares their name .

#Text=They therefore , tend to view all reasons for doing business with them from their point of view : ‘ We ’re honest ’ ; ‘ We ’ve been in business 30 years ’ ; ‘ Our customers love us ’ : ‘ We have the lowest prices ’ , etc. , etc.
#Text=While all these statements may be true , they have little effect on enticing people to decide to patronize a particular business .
#Text=The reason ?
#Text=All these statements are features that favor the business .
#Text=As an example , ‘ We have the largest selection anywhere ’ , does n’t speak to anything in particular that a customer may really want .
#Text=Strong Marketing Separates ‘ Wants from Needs ’ :
#Text=When I meet with new business owners , I typically ask them what they do and who their ideal client is .
#Text=Most will tell me that ‘ anyone ’ can use their service or ‘ everyone ’ needs what they have .
#Text=Here ’s reality .
#Text=Not everyone wants what you have to sell .
#Text=In fact , people will buy what they really want before they buy what they need .
#Text=And since ‘ Wants ’ are driven by emotions , trying to sell people with general feature based statements will not move anyone to purchase anything .
#Text=Attracting Customers Requires Understanding How they Make Decisions :
#Text=In the face of numerous choices , people will do one of two things .
#Text=They either defer the decision all together because they are too overwhelmed with the choices or they will find something specific to make the decision on .
#Text=What they choose as a differentiation point is unique to what is important to them .
#Text=For some , it could be convenience ; for others it could be variety .
#Text=But for all , there has to be a specific reason for selecting one business over the next when multiple businesses serve the same purpose .

#Text=In the event that none of the choices have any particular benefit that the consumer values and the consumer ‘ needs ’ to make a choice- i.e. a non emergency repair , they will most likely focus on price as all choices appear to be the same .
#Text=Profitable Customers Come from Niche Marketing Rather Than Mass Marketing : If you are one of the Fortune 500 , you can afford to advertise to the world .
#Text=Often times , these companies are working on brand or company image .
#Text=Other times , it ’s a simple matter of staying visible as in the case of Coke vs. Pepsi .
#Text=Here is a factoid that will make your hair curl ; it takes approximately $ 100 million to establish a national brand in the US today .
#Text=The small businesses that are successful in today ’s sea of marketing overload have focused on a particular niche .
#Text=Niche marketing does not have to be geographically based .
#Text=In fact , the more specific your client profile is and the better you match up to them with what they value , the more profitable you will be .

#Text=There is no magic bullet for attracting customers in today ’s marketplace : Like any proven method , successfully attracting customers requires a systematic approach focused on what you do that uniquely benefits the customers you want .
#Text=They will buy what they want well before they buy what they need so marketing to their ‘ wants ’ trumps broad-based advertising every time .
#Text=They will buy from you if they see a clear reason why you are a better choice than your competition .
#Text=People are not just looking for products and services , they are looking for solutions .
#Text=Show them that what you have is the perfect solution for what they want and you ’ll never have to ‘ sell ’ again !

#Text=Invest in Doing It Right So Your Results are Worthwhile : If you have not considered this kind of marketing approach because you do n’t think you can make it work for your business , get help from a professional who specializes in marketing strategies like these .
#Text=Marketing takes time to gain traction and can drain your bank account if you are not sure of what to do .

#Text=And when it comes to opportunity costs ( the revenue you are not getting now because of what you are not doing to get it ) doing the same things over and over is not a successful way to attract the customers you really want .
